video.title: AWS SysOps Administrator Associate 2020 (PASS THE EXAM!)
video.description:
AWS SysOps Administrator Associate (SO1-C01) is intended for individuals who are pursuing a career in DevOps. This course covers DevOps topics relating to configuration, automation, patching and monitoring cloud services and virtual servers. By the end of this full course taught by an expert trainer, you will be ready to take the AWS SysOps Administrator Associate  - and pass!

🎥This course was too long to fit in a single video. Watch part two here (2 more hours): 
https://youtu.be/zb1xYOdUmk8

✏️ Course developed by Andrew Brown of ExamPro. Check out the ExamPro YouTube channel: https://www.youtube.com/ExamProChannel
🔗 ExamPro AWS Obsessed Certification Training: https://www.exampro.co
🔗 LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/andrew-wc-brown
🐦 Twitter: https://twitter.com/andrewbrown

⭐Course Contents⭐
Check the pinned comment for the course contents with time codes. This course is so massive the full contents won't fit in this description!

--

Learn to code for free and get a developer job: https://www.freecodecamp.org
Read hundreds of articles on programming: https://freecodecamp.org/news

topLevelComment.author: Carlone Rosse
topLevelComment.text:
Download Updated Amazon SOA-C02 Practice Exam Material Here: https://www.validexamdumps.com/amazon/soa-c02-dumps
I hope this post will be useful for people who wants to take next step in their career and Pass Amazon AWS Certified SysOps Administrator - Associate (2021) SOA-C02 Exam certification. The range of knowledge as you can see is wide and sometimes you need to know the details, but this will make you a better specialist and will open more opportunities in front of you. I hope you pass Amazon SOA-C02 exam questions and find your name under Amazon Associate AWS Certified SysOps Administrator - Associate (2021) !

topLevelComment.author: Krazyito
topLevelComment.text: is it required to get the CCP before Sysops? or can i just go straight to SysOps?

replies.author: Charles Okojie
replies.text: You can just go straight to Sysops. Studying CP would make it easier for you to know what all the services you are to configure in Sysps do. but CP is not actually needed if you can go back to check an overview of what any service does.

topLevelComment.author: Matthew Podolak
topLevelComment.text: there is quite a few audio issues in the first 20mins

topLevelComment.author: Russell Bennett
topLevelComment.text: If youve already passed the developer or solutions architect this video isnt going to help you much in the sysops exam. You'd be better off spending the time just skim reading the whitepapers or faqs because the exam is more like the Cloud Practioner where there are clear right and wrong answers on every question. If you already have a strong knowledge of AWS (at associate level) you just need to learn common errors and how to resolve them. Then the exam is straight forward

topLevelComment.author: Ali Bajwa

topLevelComment.author: Elang Swa Buana Putra
topLevelComment.text: Thanks for this Free Course, because of this I interested buy the course to support the Team, their Practice Exam also help me build confidence in the Exam, I already pass the Exam, Mainly I use this for Study and do some Hands-on myself to catch-up with the AWS Update ( Mainly only UI Update and some new services ) If you want to pass the exam with ease I recommend to do more hands-on because it will be helpful when answering the questions.

topLevelComment.author: Jared Thompson
topLevelComment.text: Thank you, I am enjoying the content, but you might want to slow down just a little. I have seen 5 times where you have incorrect information on the screen when it sounds like you do know the right info. https://youtu.be/KX_AfyrhlgQ?t=13701 /25 = 128 and  /23 = 512.

replies.author: Jared Thompson
replies.text: 5:07:08 You say NACLS are Stateless (Any allowed inbound is also allowed outbound) THIS IS EXACTLY WRONG! That is the definition of Stateful and the way an SG works.

topLevelComment.author: Zakir Khan
topLevelComment.text: In cloud GiB is not Gigabyte , it is GibiByte, right? , bcs at 7:20 u r saying it as GigaByte and terrabyte. Also ASG flow along is not completed :( till the end when it should autoscale

topLevelComment.author: Zakir Khan
topLevelComment.text: @ 2:30, Is SSL deprecated or TLS, as per my knowledge SSL, but in ur video is showing TLS deprecated......eeeehhhhhhgggggg

topLevelComment.author: Zakir Khan
topLevelComment.text: at 20.40, i think cloud watch can not monitor memory usage of instance by default. we need to install some external agents to get those details, right?

replies.author: Dylan Keyer
replies.text: Yes, the CloudWatch Agent. He notes this numerous times as the video progresses.

topLevelComment.author: malkin cho
topLevelComment.text: 4:21:48 bash script for those who need it :) public.html #!/usr/bin/env bash su ec2-user sudo yum install httpd -y sudo service httpd start sudo su -c "cat > /var/www/html/index.html < Call to Arms EOL" private.html #!/usr/bin/env bash su ec2-user echo -e "kaiwinn\nkaiwinn" | passwd ec2-user sudo sed -i "/^[^#]*PasswordAuthentication[[:space:]]no/c\PasswordAuthentication yes" /etc/ssh/sshd_config sudo service sshd restart
